definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: There was a recent photo of his parents along with the letter.
sentences.chinese: 信中还附着一张他父母的近照。

sentences.english: Please send in comprehensive resume and recent photograph to us.
sentences.chinese: 清将简历和近照寄到本公司。

sentences.english: Here's a close up of these chokes, notice the bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 这有些生锈电感的近照，注意那些气泡。

sentences.english: The admiral flipped the chart and showed a close-up of the submarine.
sentences.chinese: 海军上将翻动图样，展示一幅这艘潜艇的近照。

sentences.english: The latest pictures of her confirmed these rumors.
sentences.chinese: 她的近照证实了这些传言。

sentences.english: Please mark on the envelope the position you apply for.
sentences.chinese: 请将申请信，简历及您的近照寄至本公司。

sentences.english: Your passport application form should be accompanied by two recent photographs.
sentences.chinese: 你的护照申请表需附两张近照。

sentences.english: Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
sentences.chinese: 申请表上请贴一张近照。

definition: a person's face as seen from the front
head-and-shoulders photo (esp. a formal one used in a passport, ID card etc)
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to take a joint photo/group photo
